body: @YaoiEmperor In civilized real places, if it is her hometown, so she knows her way around, why would she be too young to walk around town by herself? Additionally, her even having the idea of going out by herself implies a higher maturity, and the whole premise of the story implies that the depicted society gives more credit to the ability of children to make their own decisions given sufficient individual maturity.
isn't she a little too young to walk around the town by herself?
